ai-tha-ap27:1.1_0: “A Buddha praised the appearance of a golden palanquin,
ai-tha-ap27:1.2_0: if he is on the highway;
ai-tha-ap27:2.1_0: the flame of the world’s end.
ai-tha-ap27:3.1_0: having been consecrated by the Buddha,
ai-tha-ap27:3.3_0: A great sage in the world,
ai-tha-ap27:4.1_0: where he was a large crowd
ai-tha-ap27:4.2_0: if it is a big help to the Buddha for himself;
ai-tha-ap27:4.4_0: I’ll rejoice in heaven for an eon.’
ai-tha-ap27:5.1_0: if he makes his four eons;
ai-tha-ap27:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap27:5.4_0: this gift is the fruit of giving.
ai-tha-ap27:6.3_0: I’ve realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
ai-tha-ap27:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Piṅgiyānī.
ai-tha-ap27:8.1_0: for the fifth Elder Nun Punabbasuka’s Universal Monarch.
